text.0: ye gods raise up once more the man whom ye have humbled and brought low.
text.1: o gods restore to life again the man who hatb committed sin.
text.2: two several winds are blowing here from sindhu from a distant land.
text.3: may one breathe energy to thee the other blow disease away.
text.4: hither o wind blow healing balm blow all disease away thou wind.
text.5: for thou who hast all medicine comest as envoy of the gods.
text.6: i am come nigh to thee with balms to give thee rest and keep thee safe.
text.7: i bring thee blessed strength i drive thy weakening malady away.
text.8: here let the gods deliver him the maruts band deliver him.
text.9: all things that be deliver him that he be freed from his disease.
text.10: the waters have their healing power the waters drive disease away.
text.11: the waters have a balm for all let them make medicine for thee.
text.12: the tongue that leads the voice precedes then with our tenfold branching hands.
text.13: with these two chasers of disease we stroke thee with a gentle touch.
